intro: Pharbitis preauxii, commonly known as the scarlet runner bean, is a climbing legume native to Central and South America. It produces striking red or orange flowers and edible, bean-like pods that contain seeds used in cooking. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets and is often grown for its ornamental value as well as its culinary uses. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil and full sun. The species is part of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with trumpet-shaped blooms.
